paper_abstract: A rainbow subgraph of an edge-colored graph has all edges of distinct colors. A random d-regular graph with d even, and having edges colored randomly with d/2 of each of it colors, has a rainbow Hamilton cycle with probability tending to I as it -> infinity , for fixed d >= 8. (c) 2006 Wiley Periodicals. Inc.
paper_title: Rainbow Hamilton cycles in random regular graphs
